result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua H Huiras was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants payment plan of $100 per month commencing 4-1-16. Failure to pay will result in one day in jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant must submit DNA sample while in custody

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua H Huiras in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendation. Counsel makes recommendation. Court renders sentence.

2/2/2016 Hearing
   Exhibit 1 located in CD/DVD Exhibit binder
Sentencing hearing at 02-17-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Joshua H Huiras in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel files plea questionnaire, requesting adjournment for sentencing. State moves to dismiss counts 2; Court so grants.  State recommends on Count 1:  (40 days jail, fine of $400+costs, AODA assessment, 14 mo IID, 14 mo driver license revocation).  Court examines defendant on plea questionnaire.  Defendant changes plea to no contest.  Court accepts change of plea & finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua H Huiras in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sgt. Justin Kaas sworn and testifies. Court breaks to prepare video. 3:06pm case recalled; same appearances. Video up to traffic stop is played. State requests court deny motion. Attorney Barrette requests court grant motion. Court denies motion to suppress evidence. Video marked as evidence.
State's

Defendant Joshua H Huiras in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Barrette requests motion be scheduled. State concerned with lateness of motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
to Suppress Evidence Derived from Unlawful Search and Seizure.   Scanned and forwarded to Branch 2 for review.

Further proceedings at 09-08-2015 01:15 pm

Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Joshua H Huiras in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette.  Patricia Clare Bradford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received copy of complaint, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
